title: r/Relationships Should I Give My Child $70,000?
description:
r/Relationships_Advice In today's episode, OP promised that he would match whatever money his son spent in buying a new car. Well, in a shocking twist, the teenage son ended up earning over $35,000 in the stock market. That means that OP has to add his own $35,000 to equal $70,000 for a new car. Should a teenage boy really get a brand new $70,000 car? Or should he break his promise to his son and do something else with the money? If you like this podcast and want to see more, follow my podcast for more Reddit content!
